Title: LOG2()
Description: Return the base-2 logarithm of the argument

Returns the base-2 logarithm of
            X. If
            X is less than or equal to 0.0E0,
            the function returns NULL and a warning
            “Invalid argument for logarithm” is reported.
            Returns NULL if
            X is NULL.

LOG2() is useful for finding
            out how many bits a number requires for storage. This
            function is equivalent to the expression
            LOG(X) /
            LOG(2).
